tools.name: OpenStack
tools.description: Open source cloud computing platform that controls large pools of compute, storage, and networking resources throughout a datacenter, managed through a dashboard or API

tools.name: VMware Cloud Foundation
tools.description: Integrated software stack that bundles compute, storage, networking, and management to deliver a hybrid cloud platform

tools.name: Red Hat OpenShift
tools.description: Enterprise Kubernetes platform that includes private cloud capabilities along with container orchestration

tools.name: Apache CloudStack
tools.description: Open source cloud computing software for creating, managing, and deploying infrastructure cloud services

tools.name: VMware vSphere
tools.description: Virtualization platform consisting of ESXi hypervisor and vCenter management software, serving as the foundation for many private clouds

tools.name: Microsoft Hyper-V
tools.description: Microsoft's hardware virtualization product that enables creating and managing virtual machines on Windows systems

tools.name: KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine)
tools.description: Open source virtualization technology built into Linux that allows the kernel to function as a hypervisor

tools.name: Xen Project
tools.description: Free and open-source type-1 hypervisor that allows multiple operating systems to share the same hardware

tools.name: Nutanix
tools.description: Enterprise cloud platform that brings the agility and simplicity of public cloud to private datacenter infrastructure

tools.name: Proxmox VE
tools.description: Open source server management platform for enterprise virtualization that integrates KVM hypervisor and LXC containers

tools.name: OpenNebula
tools.description: Simple but feature-rich open source solution to build and manage private clouds and virtualization data centers

tools.name: Eucalyptus
tools.description: Open source software for building AWS-compatible private and hybrid clouds

tools.name: AWS Outposts
tools.description: Fully managed service that extends AWS infrastructure, services, and tools to virtually any datacenter, co-location space, or on-premises facility

tools.name: Azure Stack
tools.description: Extension of Azure that lets you run apps in an on-premises environment and deliver Azure services in your datacenter

tools.name: Google Anthos
tools.description: Google's modern application management platform that extends Google Cloud services and engineering practices to your environments

tools.name: IBM Cloud Private
tools.description: Enterprise-grade application platform for developing and managing containerized applications across on-premises, public and private clouds
